Title: Settings Management
Description: Configure application settings, themes, shortcuts, and user preferences.

Topics.Title: Settings Overview
Topics.Summary: Overview of the application settings and configuration options.
Topics.Content:
Settings Overview

The Settings area allows you to configure various aspects of the application to suit your needs. It is organized into several categories:

  • Themes: Customize the visual appearance.
  • Shortcuts: Manage keyboard shortcuts.
  • User Management: Add, edit, or remove application users.
  • Database: Configure database connection settings.
  • Master Data: Manage core data lists (Item Types, Locations, Operations, Part IDs).
  • About: View version information and release notes.

Topics.Title: Theme & Appearance
Topics.Summary: Customize the application's visual theme and behavior.
Topics.Content:
Theme Settings

Personalize the application's look and feel.

Visual Themes

Select a theme from the dropdown menu:

  • Default: Standard light theme with high contrast.
  • Dark: Dark mode for low-light environments.
  • Blue: Professional blue-tinted interface.
  • Forest: Calming green-tinted interface.

Behavior Settings

  • Enable Animations: Toggle UI animations for smoother transitions. Disable this for faster performance on older hardware.
  • Auto Expand Panels: Automatically expand side panels when navigating to tabs.
  • Show Total Summary Panel: Toggle the visibility of the summary panel at the bottom of the screen.

Topics.Title: Keyboard Shortcuts
Topics.Content:
Shortcut Management

Customize keyboard shortcuts to match your workflow.

Managing Shortcuts

  1. Expand a category (e.g., Inventory, Navigation) to view available actions.
  2. Click the Edit (...) button next to an action.
  3. Press the new key combination to assign it.
  4. Click Save to apply the change.

Resetting Defaults

Click the Reset to Defaults button to restore all shortcuts to their original system settings.

Topics.Title: User Management
Topics.Summary: Add, edit, and remove application users.
Topics.Content:
User Management

Manage the list of authorized users for the application.

Add User

  1. Select the Add User tile.
  2. Enter the User ID (e.g., Employee ID).
  3. Enter the Full Name.
  4. Select the Role (Normal, Admin, Developer, ReadOnly).
  5. Click Save.

Edit User

  1. Select the Edit User tile.
  2. Search for and select the user to edit.
  3. Update the Full Name or Role.
  4. Click Save.

Remove User

  1. Select the Remove User tile.
  2. Search for and select the user to remove.
  3. Click Remove and confirm the action.

Topics.Title: Database Configuration
Topics.Content:
Database Configuration

Configure the connection to the MySQL database server. Warning: Changing these settings may disconnect the application from the server.

Settings

  • Server Address: The hostname or IP address of the MySQL server (e.g., localhost).
  • Port: The port number (default: 3306).
  • Database Name: The name of the application database (default: mtm_wip_application_winforms).

Click Save to apply changes. The application may need to restart to reconnect.

Topics.Title: Master Data Management
Topics.Summary: Manage Item Types, Locations, Operations, and Part IDs.
Topics.Content:
Master Data Management

Manage the core lists used throughout the application for validation and suggestions.

Categories

  • Item Types: Manage the list of valid item types (e.g., Coil, Sheet, Part).
  • Locations: Manage valid inventory locations.
  • Operations: Manage manufacturing operation codes.
  • Part IDs: Manage the list of valid part numbers (if not synced from ERP).

Actions

For each category, you can:

  • Add: Create a new entry.
  • Edit: Rename or modify an existing entry.
  • Remove: Delete an entry from the list.

Topics.Title: About & Release Notes
Topics.Summary: View application version and release history.
Topics.Content:
About the Application

View version information and copyright details.

Release Notes

Click the View Release Notes button to see a detailed history of changes, improvements, and bug fixes in the current and previous versions.
